meanings.sent1: After the picture fell, I had to rehang it on the wall.
meanings.sent2: She decided to rehang the curtains to let more light in.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally rehung my coat on the wrong hook, and it looked funny.
meanings.sent4: The idea of rehanging the old chandelier in the dining room sparked joy.
meanings.sent5: The artist carefully rehung the painting to showcase it better.

meanings.definition: To suspend or be suspended again.
meanings.sent1: The wind blew the sign off the hook, so I had to rehang it.
meanings.sent2: He had to rehang the bird feeder after the storm knocked it down.
meanings.sent3: I rehung the wind chime, but it kept getting tangled in the branches.
meanings.sent4: The flag fluttered proudly after being rehung on the flagpole.
meanings.sent5: She rehung the hammock between the trees for a relaxing afternoon.

meanings.definition: To place or be placed in a different position or location.
meanings.sent1: I decided to rehang the clock on the opposite wall for a change.
meanings.sent2: The painting looked better when rehung above the fireplace.
meanings.sent3: He rehung the mirror sideways just to see how it would look.
meanings.sent4: The rearranged furniture made the room feel fresh after rehanging everything.
meanings.sent5: She rehung the keys on the hook by the door to remember them easily.
